shell.Tip: Not sure where you are?  Use PWD (Print Working Directory) to give the path of the directory you're currently in!
Remember to use 'ls-a' when in a directory to list all the hidden files.
to go back to your home directory, use 'CD ~' from wherever you are.
You can move CREATE ('touch'), REMOVE ('rm'), MOVE ('mv') or COPY ('cp') files in your shell terminal!
Getting a permissions error?  Put 'sudo' at the start of your command to initialize a command as the admin user.
